commit_message:
Update api-ref for uuid type and fix tox

The API reference documentation theme now supports the "uuid" type[1].
This patch updates the Octavia API reference to use the uuid type where
appropriate to clarify the type.

This patch also fixes the api-ref tox target for the new documentation
requirements.txt file.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/528597/

Change-Id: Ia7dfe2a26140fba0208531bd8e8e82163eb75347

commit_message:
Replace Chinese punctuation with English punctuation

Curly quotes(Chinese punctuation) usually input from Chinese input method.
When read from english context, it makes some confusion.

subject: Zuul: Remove project name
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 02:03:12.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/projects.yaml'], 'message': 'Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I1e2446a9ce0d6d1378a627963db1bb71533c21f7
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I1e2446a9ce0d6d1378a627963db1bb71533c21f7

subject: Remove use of construct lib FieldError exception
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6637, 'name': 'Sam Betts', 'email': 'sam@code-smash.net', 'username': 'sambetts'}, {'_account_id': 9542, 'name': 'Pavlo Shchelokovskyy', 'email': 'pshchelokovskyy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'pshchelo'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 14760, 'name': 'John L. Villalovos', 'email': 'openstack.org@sodarock.com', 'username': 'jlvillal'}, {'_account_id': 21909, 'name': 'Bob Fournier', 'email': 'bfournie@redhat.com', 'username': 'bfournie'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-24 19:41:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove use of construct lib FieldError exception

Version 2.8.22 of the construct lib has introduced a change that
removed the core.FieldError exception. Since the explicit
exception handling when parsing LLDP is not necessary, this has
been replaced by a general exception.

Change-Id: I31922c2afc2018a4f6f7ba48094388070537a13f
Closes-Bug: 1745208
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-01-26 02:57:39.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_inspector/common/lldp_parsers.py'], 'message': 'Remove use of construct lib FieldError exception

Version 2.8.22 of the construct lib has introduced a change that
removed the core.FieldError exception. The check now uses the
parent exception - core.ConstructError.

Change-Id: I31922c2afc2018a4f6f7ba48094388070537a13f
Closes-Bug: 1745208
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Remove use of construct lib FieldError exception

Version 2.8.22 of the construct lib has introduced a change that
removed the core.FieldError exception. The check now uses the
parent exception - core.ConstructError.

Change-Id: I31922c2afc2018a4f6f7ba48094388070537a13f
Closes-Bug: 1745208

subject: Update docs config for storyboard bugs
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 01:24:25.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py', 'api-ref/source/conf.py', 'releasenotes/source/conf.py'], 'message': 'Update docs config for storyboard bugs

commit_message:
Update docs config for storyboard bugs

This patch updates the docs configuration to have bugs links that take the
reporter to storyboad instead of launchpad.
It also sets the docs up for PDF rendering and multiple versions of the
documentation.

Change-Id: I66187e09e038efe605db45a26e3505218a7a4c65

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-25 14:01:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Neutron: make metadata proxy work

- corrected the path of "socket" volume, which is used for sharing
  metadata proxy unix socket among the agents
- and give neutron user permission to write to the dir
- set the default nova_metadata_ip to full hostname of metadata
  so that it could be accessed properly via ingress
- removed some unnecessary configurations from values

Change-Id: I4d20dc670fecebd9799851d659c5f42edb4821ac
Closes-Bug:1745370

commit_message:
Neutron: make metadata proxy work

- corrected the path of "socket" volume, which is used for sharing
  metadata proxy unix socket among the agents
- and give neutron user permission to write to the dir
- set the default nova_metadata_ip to full hostname of metadata
  so that it could be accessed properly via ingress
- removed unnecessary configurations from values

Change-Id: I4d20dc670fecebd9799851d659c5f42edb4821ac
Closes-Bug:1745370

commit_message:
Handle missing security groups on listener delete

On listener create or delete we update the VIP security group rules to
reflect the addition or removal of the TCP port on the VIP.
In the unusual event that the security group is missing in neutron, even
listener delete calls would fail.
This patch allows listener deletes to continue if the security group is
missing from the VIP.

Change-Id: Ic0186c34d3215869f1b92bcd4c8e015e0dd54053
Story: 2001381
Task: 5955

By switching to puppetforge, we have a better change of setting up a
reverse proxy cache in openstack-infra, then using github.com.

commit_message:
Convert with-X-master tox periodic jobs

Convert the following jobs to Zuul v3 native jobs:
* legacy-periodic-py27-with-oslo-master
* legacy-periodic-py35-with-oslo-master
* legacy-periodic-py35-with-neutron-lib-master
* legacy-periodic-py35-with-ovsdbapp-master

Thanks to tox_install_siblings, this really simplifies the job.

This was tested with:
* https://review.openstack.org/540587
* https://review.openstack.org/540588

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/540592
Change-Id: Ie427b7f5fb217783c024bccce85bcdb2b823e54a

deleting our current SSH keys on the remote node should be best

we cannot delete SSH keys.

Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
ignore_errors for post-ssh.yaml

Currently we are not using any static nodes in nodepool / zuul, so
deleting our current SSH keys on the remote node should be best
effort.  This should help successful jobs from no longer failing when
we cannot delete SSH keys.

Change-Id: I3dc94182e55e0be6ea118008d492d0da8e462a65
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add traits to the ResourceProviders filters

This patch adds support for selecting ResourceProviders based on
required traits. 'Preferred' traits will need to be handled as part of
the weighing process.

Blueprint: resource-provider-tags

Change-Id: I233a23e6fd9166e057bc7d57477977ecd7d3a08a

subject: Unable to grow/shrink Vertica 9.x cluster
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 21:14:47.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/vertica/system.py'], 'message': 'Unable to grow/shrink Vertica 9.x cluster

During the Vertica cluster growing/shrinking,
the "update_vertica" command tries to get AWS
metadata even if --ignore-aws-instance-type is
specified.

The only way to avoid the "_get_macs error" is to
define --ignore-install-config option.

This is very similar to this bug[1] but this time
this for the "trove cluster-grow" and "trove
cluster-shrink" commands.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/trove/+bug/1745493

Change-Id: I35f2035039f72b3aa2d9beb665096d4fb57e1c4c
Closes-Bug: #1747050
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Unable to grow/shrink Vertica 9.x cluster

During the Vertica cluster growing/shrinking,
the "update_vertica" command tries to get AWS
metadata even if --ignore-aws-instance-type is
specified.

The only way to avoid the "_get_macs error" is to
define --ignore-install-config option.

This is very similar to this bug[1] but this time
this for the "trove cluster-grow" and "trove
cluster-shrink" commands.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/trove/+bug/1745493

Change-Id: I35f2035039f72b3aa2d9beb665096d4fb57e1c4c
Closes-Bug: #1747050

commit_message:
Replace None with - (hyphen) for value None

In the detail pages, we use 'None' if a corresponding value
is empty, but '-' looks easier to recognize that it is empty
compared to 'None'.

Change-Id: I7613cdd773cd4e70aeb8434efca90cdaf6dc69ea

commit_message:
Make switched multiple choice field work

Due to horizon bug 1732260, ThemableCheckboxSelectMultiple seems
not to work as 'switched' field. The workaround is to replace it
with CheckboxSelectMultiple.

Change-Id: I763291ccbef1660415769fc66a940f7ecd11bbf6
Closes-Bug: #1747011

subject: Fix issue with missing url parameters
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-03 17:17:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix issue with missing url parameters

OSC uses these. project_id and tenant_id for neutron are interchangable.
If we list them in the QueryParameters list as project_id='tenant_id'
then a user can specify either. We'd done this for all of the *other*
Resources, but for some reason Network was left out.

ip_version is a valid query parameter for network_ip_availability, and
we even have it documented, but it's not in the list either.

We should have caught this before the last release - but actually only
just now got osc-functional-tips jobs turned back on. Sigh.

Change-Id: I1037dac37b15edbd2b8a17d7ed4ba639cf8e960b
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-02-03 17:23:39.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/tests/unit/network/v2/test_network.py', 'openstack/network/v2/network_ip_availability.py', 'releasenotes/notes/fixed-url-parameters-89c57c3dd64f1573.yaml', 'openstack/network/v2/network.py'], 'message': "Fix issue with missing url parameters

OSC uses these. project_id and tenant_id for neutron are interchangable.
If we list them in the QueryParameters list as project_id='tenant_id'
then a user can specify either. We'd done this for all of the *other*
Resources, but for some reason Network was left out.

ip_version is a valid query parameter for network_ip_availability, and
we even have it documented, but it's not in the list either.

We should have caught this before the last release - but actually only
just now got osc-functional-tips jobs turned back on. Sigh.

Change-Id: I1037dac37b15edbd2b8a17d7ed4ba639cf8e960b
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fix issue with missing url parameters

OSC uses these. project_id and tenant_id for neutron are interchangable.
If we list them in the QueryParameters list as project_id='tenant_id'
then a user can specify either. We'd done this for all of the *other*
Resources, but for some reason Network was left out.

ip_version is a valid query parameter for network_ip_availability, and
we even have it documented, but it's not in the list either.

We should have caught this before the last release - but actually only
just now got osc-functional-tips jobs turned back on. Sigh.

Change-Id: I1037dac37b15edbd2b8a17d7ed4ba639cf8e960b

commit_message:
Remove sample policy and config files

Now we have docs, lets point people there rather than attempting to
maintain a copy in tree.

Also update the devstack plugin to know nothing about policy.json, as it
never allowed for customizing the location or the contents anyhow, and
to build ironic.conf from scratch rather than from the sample.

Change-Id: I10a4987204eb335f1fed29d4b1d7f3e075aa1792

subject: Replace use of functools.wraps() with six.wraps()
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 00:33:01.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_inspector/test/unit/test_process.py', 'ironic_inspector/main.py', 'ironic_inspector/pxe_filter/base.py'], 'message': "Replace use of functools.wraps() with six.wraps()

In Python 2.7, functools.wraps() does not provide the '__wrapped__'
attribute. This attribute is used by
oslo_utils.reflection.get_signature() when getting the signature of a
function. If a function is decorated without the '__wrapped__'
attribute then the signature will be of the decorator rather than the
underlying function.

From the six documentation for six.wraps():
    This is exactly the functools.wraps() decorator, but it sets the
    __wrapped__ attribute on what it decorates as functools.wraps()
    does on Python versions after 3.2.

Change-Id: I11bf2fa945d36bfbc89ec8239e7c9259e3e12496
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Replace use of functools.wraps() with six.wraps()

In Python 2.7, functools.wraps() does not provide the '__wrapped__'
attribute. This attribute is used by
oslo_utils.reflection.get_signature() when getting the signature of a
function. If a function is decorated without the '__wrapped__'
attribute then the signature will be of the decorator rather than the
underlying function.

From the six documentation for six.wraps():
    This is exactly the functools.wraps() decorator, but it sets the
    __wrapped__ attribute on what it decorates as functools.wraps()
    does on Python versions after 3.2.

Change-Id: I11bf2fa945d36bfbc89ec8239e7c9259e3e12496

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
Ceph: Include release name in cluster roles to prevent collision

This PS includes the release name in the cluster role to prevent
colision if the chart is deployed multiple times in the same
cluster.

commit_message:
Add tenant_id parameter to be mapped to project_id in network object

That allows to filter networks based on tenant_id parameter and
makes functional test NetworkTests.test_tag_operation from
openstackclient.tests.functional.network.v2.test_network module
pass again.

subject: Switch horizon projects to publish-to-pypi-horizon
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 21:55:29.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/projects.yaml'], 'message': 'Switch horizon projects to publish-to-pypi-horizon

While checking some stable release changes, it was found there
are a few horizon plugin projects that have not been updated
since the changes with zuulv3. There are a few projects that
either require horizon to be installed, or have not yet
explicitly declared support for the normal publish-to-pypi
release job.

Until they state otherwise, we need to switch these projects
over to the -horizon flavor of this job to be able to pass
validation.

Change-Id: I8bc5bc8101d8375ab20b7e07dd1bfb2f087b20d7
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Switch horizon projects to publish-to-pypi-horizon

While checking some stable release changes, it was found there
are a few horizon plugin projects that have not been updated
since the changes with zuulv3. There are a few projects that
either require horizon to be installed, or have not yet
explicitly declared support for the normal publish-to-pypi
release job.

Until they state otherwise, we need to switch these projects
over to the -horizon flavor of this job to be able to pass
validation.

Change-Id: I8bc5bc8101d8375ab20b7e07dd1bfb2f087b20d7

commit_message:

From openstackdocstheme 1.18.0, valid Git URLs can be retrieved by
openstackdocstheme[1], we do not need giturl option anymore.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/532163

Change-Id: Ic7ad09aaebc5951fe8e3a254ba1cee2d61b486f8

commit_message:
save tenant_id in ACLMatchCriteria table

Because of null tenant_id, vnffg delete operation fails to delete
entry from ACLMatchCriteria.Hence delete attemp on parent table fails
with DBReferenceError.

Co-Authored-By: Dharmendra Kushwaha<dharmendra.kushwaha@nectechnologies.in>
Closes-Bug: 1658364
Change-Id: I699f66dfa2eab49dc5239e70973b68967f4d0142

commit_message:
Set ufw default policy for routed and outgoing

The charm neglected to set default policy for routed which cases
applications deployed to containers to fail to deploy.

This change explicitly sets default policy allow for routed and
outgoing.

Closes-Bug: #1747032

Change-Id: I440e5e040ad433bf0cf6c4ce99439da456476914

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: VPNInstance and VRF improvements

* use a proper base class for VRF dataplane classes
* improve VPNInstance and VRF unit tests, to
  - avoid multithreading in the text
  - use assert_called_once and assert_not_called
    when possible

Change-Id: Iab4ce99ca5af8ffa278686a5bcd8fe1d5f86239b

commit_message:
Set ondelete='CASCADE' on foreign key

This commit actually do the samething as this patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/534225/ did. But this commit will
update db after the patch "Some DB version is missing":
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/536713/. In order to avoid the bug
https://bugs.launchpad.net/zun/+bug/1744881. This commit changes the
'ForeignKey' attribute with ondelete='CASCADE' in ContainerAction
and ContainerActionEvent model.

Change-Id: Ib91cc31569a7a3ccc324f36626b4c186ba0b060c

commit_message:
Don't run deploy jobs for docs-only changes

This change adds .rst and doc/ to the list of irrelevant files
for the gate jobs in order to allow only the openstack-docs gate job
to run when a change only affects documentation.

Change-Id: Ie55bbe21433781e5e89896efea83cbc7956085d0

commit_message:
Switch ec2-api gate job to use ec2api tempest plugin

ec2api tempest plugin[1] is ready to use for testing the
ec2-api in gate.

This patch moves the 'functional-neutron-dsvm-ec2api'
job to run test from plugin.

next patch will use the plugin for other job too if needed
and remove the in-tree tests on successful execution.

.. 1 https://github.com/openstack/ec2api-tempest-plugin

Change-Id: I31b59008f76981b832cb2f7a651858c5c02d494f

commit_message:
Remove deprecated io_loop argument

The argument io_loop on the ioloop.PeriodicCallback constructor is
deprecated in newer tornado versions, so we can just remove it.

Since we are using tornado<=4.5.2 on stable/pike, we can correctly set
master's version to tornado>=4.5.3.

Story: 2001489
Task: 6218

Change-Id: Id621d5b609e1bf4eac3a3dd4aff44436dd012b87

commit_message:
Fix the rabbitmq fd limits validation

After containerization of the rabbitmq service the `rabbitmqctl` call that is
made to determine the file descriptor limits doesn't give the expected results
any more (since it's executed outside of the container where the service is
running).

This patch looks up the container id with the `docker ps` command and executes
`rabbitmqctl` inside of the container.

Partial-Bug: #1744322
Change-Id: If9b09c5f43dd434f17135ba632cb6a424fd461db

commit_message:
Add scenario tests for IPv6

Currently the scenario tests are only working with IPv4 based subnets.
Since the testing of DHCPv6 based scenarios in Tempest[1] is also still
blocked by Cirros not having a proper DHCPv6 client yet[2], we copy
these tests from tempest/scenario/test_network_v6.py so that they can
run with an Ubuntu based image here.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/386525
[2] https://review.openstack.org/385875

Change-Id: I8aeb58075baf6c9760f8ced27372b3e57274b9e2
Partial-Bug: 1509924

commit_message:
Fix the haproxy config file location

The location of the haproxy config file changed after the service was
containerized. This patch fixes the location to make the HAProxy validation
work again.

Partial-Bug: #1744322
Change-Id: Ifdfb5bc68b270ed14ab21bc7f7051a3dad157b5d

commit_message:
Fix PostgreSQL dataloss on pod restart

- Make data volume mount path configurable
- Use volumeMount subPath to avoid 'lost+found' in PVC
- Set PGDATA env to match data volume mount path

Change-Id: I5988ae663d21dd09f6edece9e380a001b3a2d2df

commit_message:
Use metadata IP as DHCP service IP for subnet without gateway IP

Currently, OVN does not support DHCP for subnet without gateway IP.
This is an important feature for VMs having multi ports on multi
subnets, because two conflicting default routes should be avoided.
In the patch[1] in OVN, router option was changed from mandatory to
optional, then we can add DHCP without router option to OVN. But,
without gateway IP, we still need an IP address as DHCP service IP,
using the same IP with metadata is a choice.
This patch does not solve all the problems, a TODO is added in the
code and bug is still opening to track it.

[1]https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/b89d25e5694bc9bb0a1fbb2a025d18a2a231c633

Conflicts:
        networking_ovn/common/ovn_client.py

Change-Id: Icd93101bf8834a56f80184f0584a73a36b16b483
Partial-Bug: #1670666
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>
(cherry picked from commit 48c3fbb8b830b4fb33fa63b1e7628c8d364509c2)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 15:37:46.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/scheduler/client/test_report.py'], 'message': "Don't rely on parse.urlencode in url comparisons

The tests for allocation_candidates query parameters in test_report.py
relied on urlencode with a dict arg to create the expected_url that is
compared with the actual URL that the report client creates when
communicating with the placement service.

This is risky because the ordering of the query parameters is
not reliable when the source data is a dict. This change expands
the tests where it was used to do more explicit comparisons.

Change-Id: I2e51a4574b20c0634ad83a53c0e68261bbf0ac82
Closes-Bug: #1747001
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Don't rely on parse.urlencode in url comparisons

The tests for allocation_candidates query parameters in test_report.py
relied on urlencode with a dict arg to create the expected_url that is
compared with the actual URL that the report client creates when
communicating with the placement service.

This is risky because the ordering of the query parameters is
not reliable when the source data is a dict. This change expands
the tests where it was used to do more explicit comparisons.

Change-Id: I2e51a4574b20c0634ad83a53c0e68261bbf0ac82
Closes-Bug: #1747001

subject: Accept the IBM DB2 license during the DIB process
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 16:15:36.000000000', 'files': ['integration/scripts/files/elements/ubuntu-db2/install.d/10-db2'], 'message': 'Accept the IBM DB2 license during the DIB process

During the DB2 installation, the db2_install
process asks a question about the license. Disk
Image Builder will hang until "yes" or "no" is
manually entered.

db2_install script provides the "-y" option to
accept automatically the license.

From db2_install help:
  Specifies that you have read and agreed to the
  license agreement file in the db2/license
  directory on the CD. This parameter is mandatory
  when -n is specified.

Change-Id: I8a8330adc41cbed60c8472f925b10cf816aed44e
Closes-Bug: #1747031
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Accept the IBM DB2 license during the DIB process

During the DB2 installation, the db2_install
process asks a question about the license. Disk
Image Builder will hang until "yes" or "no" is
manually entered.

db2_install script provides the "-y" option to
accept automatically the license.

From db2_install help:
  Specifies that you have read and agreed to the
  license agreement file in the db2/license
  directory on the CD. This parameter is mandatory
  when -n is specified.

Change-Id: I8a8330adc41cbed60c8472f925b10cf816aed44e
Closes-Bug: #1747031

commit_message:
Update senlin support to use openstacksdk instead

python-senlinclient is actually just a thin wrapper around
python-openstacksdk. Instead of reworking the constructor in the Senlin
plugin to be upwards-compatible with the upcoming python-openstacksdk
release, just remove use of python-senlinclient and use the openstacksdk
client plugin instead.

Change-Id: I796e20490c0b44f8314f397f3ff65cf1acb78b7b

commit_message:
Introduce wait_backoff, fail_if_empty wrappers

* wait_backoff wrapper retries the command several time increasing backoff
  timeout exponentially. Its log is added to to stderr. All openstack calls were
  refactored to to try several time as services may be restarted during
  installation or upgrade.

* fail_if_empty wrapper fails if no output received.

* Some openstack commands were wrapped as there is a deplay between stack and
  resource creation. Usually it's not visible. However, when undercloud is
  located on small VM or cloud flavour is m1.medium then it creates a race
  condition may occur in some places.

Minor:
- let was replaced to ((i++)), for speed reason.
- sleep was added to while true, just not to abuse openstack services.

Change-Id: I435042e6f7fdfcb38d04b055ba437f273d0bfe75

commit_message:
trivial: Resolve Python 3 issues

Resolve the following exception:

  AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'decode'

This wasn't caught in the gate because that still uses Python 2.7. This
is not the case in other environments (Fedora 27).

Change-Id: I6b462f19432c4cf9948cddcc095d9d5a85feeb4b

commit_message:
libvirt: iothreads for disk devices

Accelerate disk IO performance by exploiting iothreads, which were
introduced in recent libvirt/qemu releases.

Change-Id: I8ae0b5af77aa7c6eccd42d67dc703d4ac9d2b07b
Co-Authored-By: Alexander Schmidt <alexs@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
Implements: blueprint libvirt-iothreads

[{'created': '2018-02-02 20:58:42.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/publish/static-special.yaml'], 'message': 'Switch static-special from copy to synchronize

According to notes in the Ansible documentation for the copy module,
it "does not scale to lots (>hundreds) of files." Several of the 5
sites currently relying on the publish/static-special playbook have
content numbering in the thousands of files. Other sites on the same
server instead rely on the publish/static playbook which already
uses synchronize instead of copy, so this should be entirely
compatible.

Change-Id: Iac85d906ae7c7a4666d7a5eeaa73b5a9f2ac7115
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Switch static-special from copy to synchronize

According to notes in the Ansible documentation for the copy module,
it "does not scale to lots (>hundreds) of files." Several of the 5
sites currently relying on the publish/static-special playbook have
content numbering in the thousands of files. Other sites on the same
server instead rely on the publish/static playbook which already
uses synchronize instead of copy, so this should be entirely
compatible.

Change-Id: Iac85d906ae7c7a4666d7a5eeaa73b5a9f2ac7115

commit_message:
fix same mechanism driver called twice bug

when a mechinism driver calls context.continue_binding to
continue binding, it will be called again because
_check_driver_to_bind compares driver name with driver.

Closes-Bug: #1745572
Change-Id: I62b32c9b9d01dd929fe8cd3634c78dc0cbe325b6

subject: Increase MySQL max_connections for unit tests
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-30 22:49:46.000000000', 'files': ['tools/test-setup.sh'], 'message': "Increase MySQL max_connections for unit tests

We've seen that sometimes our unit tests create a lot of mysql
connections simultaneously[1][2] and cause the tests to fail. Increase
the max_connections limit from 151 to 1024, which is what devstack
uses[3].

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/43/536543/9/check/openstack-tox-py35/0729ea7/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-01-30_19_36_38_136523
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/23/524423/44/gate/openstack-tox-py35/0f8083f/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-01-28_21_11_52_855308
[3] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-dev/devstack/tree/lib/databases/mysql?id=640150683d137a9a10dfe833e7a34b7ea6cdfb1a#n99

Change-Id: Ic9f9ca696af1876eb5a728356a98d70352ef9bc3
Related-bug: #1746016
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Increase MySQL max_connections for unit tests

We've seen that sometimes our unit tests create a lot of mysql
connections simultaneously[1][2] and cause the tests to fail. Increase
the max_connections limit from 151 to 1024, which is what devstack
uses[3].

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/43/536543/9/check/openstack-tox-py35/0729ea7/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-01-30_19_36_38_136523
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/23/524423/44/gate/openstack-tox-py35/0f8083f/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-01-28_21_11_52_855308
[3] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-dev/devstack/tree/lib/databases/mysql?id=640150683d137a9a10dfe833e7a34b7ea6cdfb1a#n99

Change-Id: Ic9f9ca696af1876eb5a728356a98d70352ef9bc3
Related-bug: #1746016

commit_message:
SFC: Agent extension fixes

* Fix delete_port behavior: Calls to ports detach in bagpipe-bgp where missing
* Fix sfc_ports_detach: Properly update port chain hops informations
* Adjust how synchronization is done
* Remove unnecessary mask from IP prefixies

Update corresponding unit tests.

Signed-off-by: Thomas Morin <thomas.morin@orange.com>
Submitted on behalf of a third-party: Orange

Change-Id: I75665ec9413a8b75f91025ecdee3dc2a6acf9482

subject: Fix test_get_allocation_candidates tests
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 20:30:51.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/scheduler/client/test_report.py'], 'message': 'Fix test_get_allocation_candidates tests

These tests randomly fail based on the hash seed used
when encoding the URL based on the dict inputs. This
fixes the tests by mocking out the keystoneauth1.get()
method to parse the URL and compare the query string
dict values properly, that is, regardless of order.

Change-Id: I438641d95ad07193bdcafc69dab9f6099ecca92b
Closes-Bug: #1747063
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix test_get_allocation_candidates tests

These tests randomly fail based on the hash seed used
when encoding the URL based on the dict inputs. This
fixes the tests by mocking out the keystoneauth1.get()
method to parse the URL and compare the query string
dict values properly, that is, regardless of order.

Change-Id: I438641d95ad07193bdcafc69dab9f6099ecca92b
Closes-Bug: #1747063

commit_message:
add scenario to create / delete subnets in parallel threads

A lot of IP allocation races can be found if we trigger IPAM code in parallel
threads. So far, no existing rally or tempest scenario ever did it.

Change-Id: Iebea2969d2ed106074677d836043776d30870e42

commit_message:
Fix openstack-service-setup.yml GATEWAY_NETWORK to match the flat network.

  This should allow the proper gateway ip to be used for connectivity to/from
  vms in the GATEWAY_NETWORK or with floating ips from it.

Change-Id: I0f4498baa2edbf24bbf2c407c6e5a2574454cfdc
Closes-Bug: 1746621

Add availability zone parameters for volume required template

Since some default templates require volume, add the availability
zone parameters for them. Otherwise the volume creation will fail.

commit_message:
Add basic bash completion to --no-discover arg

This commit adds support for doing bash completion to ostestr. It adds
basic support to do argument completion as well as adding module
searching to the --no-discover command to aid in selecting the module
to use.

Change-Id: I4e06201fc225d49d3b7bedde9beb97476cf1caa0

commit_message:
[jsonschema] Require specifying `additionalProperties` explicitly

Validation of objects via jsonschema become meaningless if there is no
`additionalProperties: False`. In case of complex schemas, it is easy to
miss this property in some child property.

Let's require always specifing additionalProperties to simplify the life
of reviewers and do not miss anything.

Change-Id: I49693a7968e820010751909a48f06f3f784c5721

and controller logic. This is the correct way to reference

Change-Id: Ieea66d86d6d28ac105c4c39bdea1d05aec8e0c46
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use keystone.common.provider_api for policy APIs

This change converts the usage of self.<provider_api> to
keystone.common.providers_api.ProviderAPIs.<provider_api> in manager
and controller logic. This is the correct way to reference
providers from other managers and controllers now that dependency
injection has been eliminated.

Change-Id: Ieea66d86d6d28ac105c4c39bdea1d05aec8e0c46

subject: Fix SELinux file contexts for nova's ssh keys
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-01 13:26:13.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/nova_selinux.yml'], 'message': "Fix SELinux file contexts for nova's ssh keys

The original SELinux file context equivalance that was added for
/var/lib/nova was too broad and needs to be made more specific.

This patch removes the old equivalence record and replaces it with
a specific file context rule. This allows live migrations to work
with CentOS 7 systems that have SELinux in enforcing mode.

Closes-Bug: 1742732
Depends-On: I52901ac48f9a95d0fe6b010f5940b5c39fce1aba
Change-Id: I8f7c750edc1c7b354343f07230eb17d1357001de
(cherry picked from commit 1a483db8d0fd629dc792c6160c182def57ee3ad3)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix SELinux file contexts for nova's ssh keys

The original SELinux file context equivalance that was added for
/var/lib/nova was too broad and needs to be made more specific.

This patch removes the old equivalence record and replaces it with
a specific file context rule. This allows live migrations to work
with CentOS 7 systems that have SELinux in enforcing mode.

Closes-Bug: 1742732
Depends-On: I52901ac48f9a95d0fe6b010f5940b5c39fce1aba
Change-Id: I8f7c750edc1c7b354343f07230eb17d1357001de
(cherry picked from commit 1a483db8d0fd629dc792c6160c182def57ee3ad3)

commit_message:
During mixed version upgrade overcloud image tags may be used.

When doing mixed upgrade if we use the docker_image_tag we get master
build id.  But we want master-1 build id.

Used with the depends on, we can have both tag for more flexibility.

Change-Id: I185a1f2c3fd2f61864b5e554ed6df4a2b438b9bc
Depends-On: I468e14d746fd5ab5a51485ee9b907efc44391c56
Related-Bug: #1745348

commit_message:
fix get_last_tag function

Depending on how things merge into a branch, the --first-parent option
might give us the wrong version. For example, python-troveclient at
26425a6 was showing 2.13.0 instead of the correct 2.14.0. Remove the
option to fix that problem.

Change-Id: I9a6996b03dc74df6963ac96887356bc6094e59b7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Missing VNIC type parameter when using it to create a port

In the project creation port page, regardless of the choice of VNIC
Type, the created port VNIC Type is displayed as Normal, since the
creation port does not specify the 'binding__vnic_type' parameter.

Change-Id: I29700b29e163363dbd7c85a2d5c68c8a6b635ee6
Closes-Bug:#1746977

commit_message:
bgpvpn: provide 'descriptions' in agent extension

This allows to have useful information about BGPVPN
in bagpipe-looking-glass:

$ bagpipe-looking-glass vpns instances
* ipvpn_b20df8a0-262e-45f0-af75-3d1b311c9f8f (...)
  description: BGPVPN association for net b20df8a0-262e-45f0-af75-3d1b311c9f8f (10.101.11.1)
  name: VRF-5
* ipvpn_d587188f-6f91-4ef4-8870-4bb241476329 (...)
  description: BGPVPN association for net d587188f-6f91-4ef4-8870-4bb241476329 (10.103.31.1)
  name: VRF-1
* ipvpn_c78d82e7-5ddf-420b-8dbb-da8e9ed80c65 (...)
  description: BGPVPN association for net c78d82e7-5ddf-420b-8dbb-da8e9ed80c65 (10.102.21.1)
  name: VRF-4

Change-Id: Id70b76bf14b3f7022ebc2dad1b6b30cdd7d822b6

subject: Improve Vertica 9.x support
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-25 22:11:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Improve Vertica 9.x support

During the Vertica installation, the install script try to get AWS
metadata even if --ignore-aws-instance-type is specified.

The only way to avoid the _get_macs error is to define
--ignore-install-config option.

During the cluster creation, if the process is too long, Vertica
ask a question:
  Do you want to continue waiting? (yes/no) [yes]

From the adminTools documentation there is no non-interactive or
timeout options. The only way to have this question answered is
to run "echo yes | " before the "adminTools -t create_db" command.

Change-Id: I94472082fac606f4ff14f26c2ca2b620ef0a3bbb

commit_message:
Improve Vertica 9.x support

During the Vertica installation, the install script try to get AWS
metadata even if --ignore-aws-instance-type is specified.

The only way to avoid the _get_macs error is to define
--ignore-install-config option.

During the cluster creation, if the process is too long, Vertica
ask a question:
  Do you want to continue waiting? (yes/no) [yes]

From the adminTools documentation there is no non-interactive or
timeout options. The only way to have this question answered is
to run "echo yes | " before the "adminTools -t create_db" command.

The only available version from Vertica website is 9.0.1.

Closes-Bug: #1745493
Change-Id: I94472082fac606f4ff14f26c2ca2b620ef0a3bbb

commit_message:
Fix senlin/sdk client plugin unit tests

New python-openstacksdk has broken the client plugins.
This also change to use `status_code` instead of `http_status`
of HttpException when checking for bad request.

Closes-Bug: #1746956
Change-Id: Ib1f295a6dea014df3237acf0efd6b84464eac9c1

commit_message:
Allow ability to configure number of processes and threads

Users can configure the number of worker threads however when it's
not specified the calculated number of workers can get too large on
hosts with a large number of CPUs.

This also adds the setting of threads and processes to the UWSGI
configuration.

Change-Id: I003ab426488966cce46bd6fd297c79ada13c9668
Closes-Bug: #1745631
(cherry picked from commit 4b0da513d06ebffad24490b9b08eb2033ee6a181)

commit_message:
Disable mistral cron-trigger subsystem

Disabling cron trigger subsystem allows to significantly increase
system performance by reducing the constant load on the processor and
the database. Since the subsystem is going to be deprecated in Mistral
soon, there is no reason to keep it enabled for TripleO.

Change-Id: I7587f1ae54a5f30743d78822b45f8aed5ba13495

commit_message:
Add ironic-inspector and iptables to captured logs

Add iptables output so we can validate the firewall config.

Also if ironic is enabled there is a good chnace that we also want to
log the ironic-inspector config/logs

[{'created': '2018-02-01 18:15:40.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/openstack_extras_auth_file_spec.rb', 'templates/openrc.erb', 'manifests/auth_file.pp'], 'message': 'Set OS_INTERFACE and OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE in auth file

OSC does not use service-specific environment variables for choosing
endpoints. It requires a common OS_INTERFACE variable that is used for
--os-interface.
OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE is the analog for older service-specific clients and is

Change-Id: I5dd8de00e72631d578cf7e0b7028705a5cda1ddb
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Set OS_INTERFACE and OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE in auth file

OSC does not use service-specific environment variables for choosing
endpoints. It requires a common OS_INTERFACE variable that is used for
--os-interface.
OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE is the analog for older service-specific clients and is
used for --os-endpoint-type.

Change-Id: I5dd8de00e72631d578cf7e0b7028705a5cda1ddb

commit_message:
Make requirements voting again, update .zuul.yaml

Change  Ibc77ea864503e63f73be0f1c41e07bfe8ea3dcae needed a non-voting
requirements change for merging, since this is in, we can make
requirements voting again. For this, just remove it.

Remove voting from the neutron-tempest-plugin-designate job since
non-voting jobs should not run in gate.

Remove name from project-stanza, this is not needed anymore.

Rename designate grenade job to follow
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#naming-with-zuul-v3

Change-Id: I794bd13bf74d2218e64b9f9922ea8abd6c9b33a0

commit_message:
Retire the trove-integration repository

With the EOL of Newton (impending) and the deletion of the legacy
tests[1] and [2], this repository is not required any longer.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/514916/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/514918/

Change-Id: I8a6466c318029e6c984c6684e92547dd94ae6488

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I32868cec22149ec1c18fe2737a65e88d32bff531

  publish the tempestconf to pypi.

subject: Move Linuxbridge ARP spoofing to nat table PREROUTING chain
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 4694, 'name': 'Miguel Lavalle', 'email': 'miguel@mlavalle.com', 'username': 'minsel'}, {'_account_id': 8655, 'name': 'Jakub Libosvar', 'email': 'libosvar@redhat.com', 'username': 'jlibosva'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11975, 'name': 'Slawek Kaplonski', 'email': 'skaplons@redhat.com', 'username': 'slaweq'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27346, 'name': 'chenxiangui', 'email': 'chenxiangui@inspur.com', 'username': 'chenxiangui'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 00:28:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Move Linuxbridge ARP spoofing to nat table PREROUTING chain

It was found that adding ebtables rules to the filter table
FORWARD chain could be vulnerable to a DoS attack.  Moving
to the nat table PREROUTING chain should mitigate this as
it is consulted prior to allowing the frame in.

Change-Id: I87852b21db4404c58c83789cc267812030ac7d5f
Closes-bug: #1732294
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-12-18 20:11:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Move Linuxbridge ARP spoofing to nat table PREROUTING chain

It was found that adding ebtables rules to the filter table
FORWARD chain could be vulnerable to a DoS attack.  Moving
to the nat table PREROUTING chain should mitigate this as
it is consulted prior to allowing the frame in.

In order to make this work with upgrades, had to make the code
detect and remove any old rules that might still exist in
the filter table.  That can be removed after a cycle.

Change-Id: I87852b21db4404c58c83789cc267812030ac7d5f
Closes-bug: #1732294
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2018-01-02 19:44:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Move Linuxbridge ARP spoofing to nat table PREROUTING chain

It was found that adding ebtables rules to the filter table
FORWARD chain could be vulnerable to a DoS attack.  Moving
to the nat table PREROUTING chain should mitigate this as
it is consulted prior to allowing the frame in.

In order to make this work with upgrades, had to make the code
detect and remove any old rules that might still exist in
the filter table.  That can be removed after a cycle.

Change-Id: I87852b21db4404c58c83789cc267812030ac7d5f

commit_message:
Move Linuxbridge ARP spoofing to nat table PREROUTING chain

It was found that adding ebtables rules to the filter table
FORWARD chain could be vulnerable to a DoS attack.  Moving
to the nat table PREROUTING chain should mitigate this as
it is consulted prior to allowing the frame in.

In order to make this work with upgrades, had to make the code
detect and remove any old rules that might still exist in
the filter table.  That can be removed after a cycle.

Added some unit tests in addition to the existing functional
tests.

Change-Id: I87852b21db4404c58c83789cc267812030ac7d5f
Closes-bug: #1732294

commit_message:
Update requirements manually

packages that are not in the global list. Manually sync
requirements.

Failure log from requirements sync:
http://logs.openstack.org/d8/d89aad257d43fe02e42e44b2a0187dbd9f505c36/post/propose-update-requirements/15a7777/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-01-31_06_51_56_655451

'dpath' is not in global-requirements.txt or blacklist.txt
'salt' is not in global-requirements.txt or blacklist.txt
'yamllint' is not in global-requirements.txt or blacklist.txt

commit_message:
monasca: backport Cassandra support

This commit backports the following patches required for
supporting the Cassandra time series database in Monasca:

monasca-api:
  * cassandra-527858.patch: adds metrics retrieval from
    Cassandra and thoroughly overhauls/fixes Cassandra support
    in Devstack.
  * cassandra-auth-533833.patch: adds support for
    authenticated Cassandra access.
  * cassandra-statistics-api-end-time-529788.patch: fixes statistics
    API for unspecified end time.
monasca-agent:
  * monitor-cassandra-538096.patch: adds detection plugin for
    the Cassandra service.
monasca-persister:
  * cassandra-527855.patch: adds support for storing metrics
    in Cassandra.

Change-Id: I17bb8195969eb697d3f126edfc0395bb338c805f

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: support VPN instance and attachment descriptions

New 'instance_description' and attachment 'description' fields
can be defined via bagpipe-bgp API. They are then exposed to
provide helpful hints in the API.

This includes moving the spec, adding a redirect so the old

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I037de402df0f084e08ab9f257886d4d15a2a66f3

commit_message:
Fix upgrade test

openstacksdk was updated to 0.10.0 which has a different
connection.Connection object, which doesn't take our auth_url.

We should respect the constraints, install the tooling in a venv,
and restrict to a known version of the sdk until more robust code
is written.

Change-Id: I681d5177c3d62d4cd44371fef0032fa8a0727dfd

Fix upgrade test

openstacksdk was updated to 0.10.0 which has a different
connection.Connection object, which doesn't take our auth_url.

We should respect the constraints, install the tooling in a venv,
and restrict to a known version of the sdk until more robust code
is written.

commit_message:
Fix upgrade test

openstacksdk was updated to 0.10.0 which has a different
connection.Connection object, which doesn't take our auth_url.

We should respect the constraints, install the tooling in a venv,
and restrict to a known version of the sdk until more robust code
is written.

Change-Id: Ibcfe3d69705833b0c743e6303feb351a464abdcf

commit_message:
Add dsvm job

Add a single node dsvm job with neutron segments enabled on
the ironic-provisioning network.

networking_baremetal mech driver and ironic-neutron-agent
enabled.

Related-Bug: #1658964
Depends-On: I041761dd896c9d89dc6cf7bafc991a0697ded05b
Change-Id: Ib4d93937c3985e51e2c10ded26af96d47b747f00

subject: Prepare virtualenvs without breaking the virtualenv tooling
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 11:56:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Properly ensure we use the right packages for each venv

The current method of simply removing the virtualenv_support
folder is a hack. In theory it's supposed to force a new
virtualenv to fetch the packages from upstream, but by using
this method, virtualenv can sometimes break when building a
new venv.

This patch implements a better method which achieves the same
goal, but does it using the tooling provided rather than the
previous hack.

Change-Id: I2c50bb693dc5dc505bddce34ff45294ac44f7dc9
Closes-Bug: #1746935

", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2018-02-02 12:12:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Properly ensure we use the right packages for each venv

The current method of simply removing the virtualenv_support
folder is a hack. It breaks virtualenv's ability to work
normally. In upgrades to Queens this is a problem as the
repo-server role sets up a virtualenv and needs it to work
normally.

This patch implements a better method which achieves the same
goal, but does it using the tooling provided rather than the
previous hack.

Change-Id: I2c50bb693dc5dc505bddce34ff45294ac44f7dc9
Closes-Bug: #1746935
", 'number': 3}, {'created': '2018-02-02 12:25:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Prepare virtualenvs without breaking the virtualenv tooling

When preparing virtualenvs, we have an implementation which
tries to ensure that the versions of pip, setuptools and
wheel are the ones we want them to be. In order to do that
we have previously removed the virtualenv_support folder
which contains the pip/setuptools/wheel versions that
virtualenv shipped with. This was done to prevent any
leaking of the wrong version into the virtualenv and was
the only way of doing it with much earlier versions of
virtualenv.

We can now update the method of achieving the same goal
without breaking the virtualenv tooling, which this patch
does.

The virtualenv_support folder missing is causing the
repo-server role which uses virtualenv to fail in upgrades
to queens. That role needs a complete and properly working
version of virtualenv in place.

Change-Id: I2c50bb693dc5dc505bddce34ff45294ac44f7dc9
Closes-Bug: #1746935

Closes-Bug: #1746935

commit_message:
Prepare virtualenvs without breaking the virtualenv tooling

When preparing virtualenvs, we have an implementation which
tries to ensure that the versions of pip, setuptools and
wheel are the ones we want them to be. In order to do that
we have previously removed the virtualenv_support folder
which contains the pip/setuptools/wheel versions that
virtualenv shipped with. This was done to prevent any
leaking of the wrong version into the virtualenv and was
the only way of doing it with much earlier versions of
virtualenv.

We can now update the method of achieving the same goal
without breaking the virtualenv tooling, which this patch
does.

The virtualenv_support folder missing is causing the
repo-server role which uses virtualenv to fail in upgrades
to queens. That role needs a complete and properly working
version of virtualenv in place.

Change-Id: I2c50bb693dc5dc505bddce34ff45294ac44f7dc9
Closes-Bug: #1746935

[{'created': '2017-11-29 18:29:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "WIP libvirt: Use QEMU's native LUKS support

within Nova when the appropriate versions of QEMU and Libvirt are

Change-Id: Ibfa64f18bbd2fb70db7791330ed1a64fe61c1355
", 'number': 3}, {'created': '2017-12-20 09:36:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP libvirt: QEMU native LUKS decryption for volumes

QEMU 2.6 and Libvirt 2.2.0 allow LUKS encrypted RAW files, block devices
and network devices (such as rbd) to be decrypted natively by QEMU. This
change enables the use of this feature within the Libvirt virt driver of
Nova when both the `volume_use_native_luks` configurable is enabled and
the appropriate versions of QEMU and Libvirt are installed.

As with the original os-brick encryptors, encrypted volumes that do not
already contain a valid LUKS header will be formatted before use. The
original os-brick LuksEncryptor class is used to format volumes that
present a local block device on the compute host.

As rbd volumes were not supported by these encryptors a separate
codepath is used to format these volumes using qemu-img. At present this
requires that the original volume is removed before being recreated by
qemu-img. Future work should look to avoid the need to recreate the
volume by using QEMU >= 2.10 to convert the image in-place and also
using c-vol to preform this task for all volume backends.

If an encrypted volume does not have a Libvirt secret associated with
it an attempt will still be made to detach LuksEncryptor from the volume.
This will ensure any encrypted volumes connected prior to this change
will still detach the LuksEncryptor correctly during detach or cleanup.

TODO
- Tests
- barbican-tempest-plugin
- swap_volume (?!)
- LM

Depends-On: I404070e2428cdf404b576d1d9da5b917f9be11d1
Implements: blueprint libvirt-qemu-native-luks
Change-Id: Ibfa64f18bbd2fb70db7791330ed1a64fe61c1355
', 'number': 4}, {'created': '2017-12-20 12:22:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP libvirt: QEMU native LUKS decryption for volumes

QEMU 2.6 and Libvirt 2.2.0 allow LUKS encrypted RAW files and block
devices to be decrypted natively by QEMU. This change enables the use of
this feature within the Libvirt virt driver of Nova when both the
`volume_use_native_luks` configurable is enabled and the appropriate
versions of QEMU and Libvirt are installed.

As with the original os-brick encryptors, encrypted volumes that do not
already contain a valid LUKS header will be formatted before use. The
original os-brick LuksEncryptor class is used to format volumes that
present a local block device on the compute host.

If an encrypted volume does not have a Libvirt secret associated with
it an attempt will still be made to detach LuksEncryptor from the volume.
This will ensure any encrypted volumes connected prior to this change
will still detach the LuksEncryptor correctly during detach or cleanup.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-qemu-native-luks
Change-Id: Ibfa64f18bbd2fb70db7791330ed1a64fe61c1355
', 'number': 5}, {'created': '2018-01-11 14:50:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP libvirt: QEMU native LUKS decryption for volumes

QEMU 2.6 and Libvirt 2.2.0 allow LUKS encrypted RAW files, block devices
and network devices (such as rbd) to be decrypted natively by QEMU. This
change enables the use of this feature within the Libvirt virt driver of
Nova when both the `volume_use_native_luks` configurable is enabled and
the appropriate versions of QEMU and Libvirt are installed.

As with the original os-brick encryptors, encrypted volumes that do not
already contain a valid LUKS header will be formatted before use. The
original os-brick LuksEncryptor class is used to format volumes that
present a local block device on the compute host.

As rbd volumes were not supported by these encryptors a separate
codepath is used to format unencrypted rbd images using qemu-img. At
present this requires that the original volume is removed before being
recreated by qemu-img.

When detaching, if an encrypted volume does not have a Libvirt secret
associated with it an attempt will still be made to detach LuksEncryptor
from the volume.  This will ensure any encrypted volumes connected prior
to this change will still detach the LuksEncryptor correctly during
detach or cleanup.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-qemu-native-luks

', 'number': 6}, {'created': '2018-01-11 20:25:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP libvirt: QEMU native LUKS decryption for volumes

QEMU 2.6 and Libvirt 2.2.0 allow LUKS encrypted RAW files, block devices
and network devices (such as rbd) to be decrypted natively by QEMU. This
change enables the use of this feature within the Libvirt virt driver of
Nova when both the `volume_use_native_luks` configurable is enabled and
the appropriate versions of QEMU and Libvirt are installed.

As with the original os-brick encryptors, encrypted volumes that do not
already contain a valid LUKS header will be formatted before use. The
original os-brick LuksEncryptor class is used to format volumes that
present a local block device on the compute host.

As rbd volumes were not supported by these encryptors a separate
codepath is used to format unencrypted rbd images using qemu-img. At
present this requires that the original volume is removed before being
recreated by qemu-img.

When detaching, if an encrypted volume does not have a Libvirt secret
associated with it an attempt will still be made to detach LuksEncryptor
from the volume.  This will ensure any encrypted volumes connected prior
to this change will still detach the LuksEncryptor correctly during
detach or cleanup.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-qemu-native-luks
Change-Id: Ibfa64f18bbd2fb70db7791330ed1a64fe61c1355

', 'number': 9}, {'created': '2018-01-15 17:12:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "libvirt: QEMU native LUKS decryption for volumes

QEMU 2.6 and Libvirt 2.2.0 allow LUKS encrypted RAW files, block devices
and network devices (such as rbd) to be decrypted natively by QEMU. This
change enables the use of this feature within Nova when the
`volume_use_native_luks` configurable is enabled, appropriate versions
of QEMU and Libvirt are installed and the encryption provider for the
volume is of type 'luks'.

When these conditions are met a Libvirt secret is created during
_connect_volume to hold the passphrase used to unlock the encrypted
volume. The presences of this Libvirt secret is then used later to
generate the required encryption XML for the disk.

When disconnecting a volume the presence of a Libvirt secret will result
in no attempt being made to detach an os-brick provided encryptor from
the volume. This will only occur when no secret is present, allowing
encrypted volumes attached prior to this change to still be detached
correctly.

Finally, attempts to swap between volumes using native QEMU decryption
will be blocked in the same manor as they are when using volumes that do
not provide a local block device. Both use cases still requiring
additional implementation work in Libvirt before being allowed within
Nova.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-qemu-native-luks

", 'number': 11}, {'created': '2018-01-17 10:28:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "WIP libvirt: QEMU native LUKS decryption for volumes

QEMU 2.6 and Libvirt 2.2.0 allow LUKS encrypted RAW files, block devices
and network devices (such as rbd) to be decrypted natively by QEMU. This
change enables the use of this feature within Nova when the appropriate
versions of QEMU and Libvirt are installed and the encryption provider
for the volume is of type 'luks'.

When these conditions are met a Libvirt secret is created when
connecting encrypted volumes to a compute host to hold the LUKS
passphrase used to unlock the volume. The presences of this Libvirt

encryption XML for the disk.

When disconnecting a volume the presence of a Libvirt secret will result
in no attempt being made to detach an os-brick provided encryptor from
the volume. This will only occur when no secret for the volume is found
on the compute host. This will allow encrypted volumes attached prior to
this change to still be detached correctly.

Attempts to swap between volumes while using native QEMU decryption will
be blocked in the same manor as they are when using volumes that do not
provide a local block device. Both use cases still requiring additional
implementation work in Libvirt before being allowed within Nova.

WIP
---

LibvirtLiveMigrateData and LibvirtLiveMigrateBDMInfo are both extended
to help with live migration with encrypted volumes attached.

For Pike to Queens migrations the was_native_luks_available attribute
is added to the LibvirtLiveMigrateData object. This is used to
identify if the source compute was capable of configuring native
LUKS decryption. When Pike is the source host this attribute will be
missing leading to the Queens destination host falling back to the
os-brick encryptors when connecting to the volume during
pre_live_migration.

For Queens to Queens migrations was_native_luks_available will be set to
True assuming the correct QEMU and Libvirt versions are installed on the
source host. The destination will then connect to the encrypted volumes
using the native LUKS approach, creating a Libvirt volume secret. The
UUID of this secret is then stored in the individual
LibvirtLiveMigrateBDMInfo object for the volume and used on the source
while updating the domains XML before starting the migration.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-qemu-native-luks

LibvirtLiveMigrateData and LibvirtLiveMigrateBDMInfo are both extended
to support the following matrix of live migration (LM) scenarios:

- Pike using os-brick encryptors to Queens using os-brick encryptors
- Queens using os-brick encryptors to Queens using os-brick encryptors
- Queens using os-brick encryptors to Queens using native QEMU decrypt
- Queens using native QEMU decrypt to Queens using native QEMU decrypt

A new 'src_supports_native_luks' attribute has been added to
LibvirtLiveMigrateData in Queens to indicate that the source host is
capable of configuring QEMU LUKS decryption for a volume during LM.

The presence of this attribute in migrate_data during pre_live_migration
on the destination is then used to decide how encrypted volumes are
connected on that host ahead of LM starting.

When missing or False the os-brick encryptors will be attached, when
present and True the native QEMU decryption approach will be taken,
creating a secret on the destination host. The UUID of this secret is
then stored in the individual LibvirtLiveMigrateBDMInfo object
associated with the volume and passed back to the source host to be
added to the volume configuration prior to the start of the live
migration.

commit_message:
libvirt: QEMU native LUKS decryption for encrypted volumes

QEMU 2.6 and Libvirt 2.2.0 allow LUKS encrypted RAW files, block devices
and network devices (such as rbd) to be decrypted natively by QEMU. This
change enables the use of this feature within Nova when the appropriate
versions of QEMU and Libvirt are installed and the encryption provider
for the volume is of type 'luks'.

When these conditions are met a Libvirt secret is created when
connecting encrypted volumes to a compute host to hold the LUKS
passphrase used to unlock the volume. The presence of this Libvirt
secret is then used by the volume driver to generate the required
encryption XML for the disk. QEMU is then able to natively read from and
write to the encrypted disk, removing the need for the os-brick supplied
dm-crypt style encryptors, previously used to handle encrypted volumes.

When disconnecting a volume the presence of a Libvirt secret will result
in no attempt being made to detach an os-brick provided encryptor from
the volume. This will only occur when no secret for the volume is found
on the compute host. This will allow encrypted volumes attached prior to
this change to still be detached correctly.

Attempts to swap between volumes while using native QEMU decryption will
be blocked in the same manner as they are when using volumes that do not
provide a local block device. Both use cases still require additional
implementation work in Libvirt before being allowed within Nova.

LibvirtLiveMigrateData and LibvirtLiveMigrateBDMInfo are both extended
to support the following matrix of live migration (LM) scenarios:

- Pike using os-brick encryptors to Queens using os-brick encryptors
- Queens using os-brick encryptors to Queens using os-brick encryptors
- Queens using os-brick encryptors to Queens using native QEMU decrypt
- Queens using native QEMU decrypt to Queens using native QEMU decrypt

A new 'src_supports_native_luks' attribute has been added to
LibvirtLiveMigrateData in Queens to indicate that the source host is
capable of configuring QEMU LUKS decryption for a volume during LM.

The presence of this attribute in migrate_data during pre_live_migration
on the destination is then used to decide how encrypted volumes are
connected on that host ahead of LM starting.

When missing or False the os-brick encryptors will be attached, when
present and True the native QEMU decryption approach will be taken only
if the destination host also supports native LUKS decryption by QEMU.

The UUID of this secret is then stored in the individual
LibvirtLiveMigrateBDMInfo object associated with the volume and passed
back to the source host to be added to the volume configuration prior to
the start of the live migration.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-qemu-native-luks
Change-Id: Ibfa64f18bbd2fb70db7791330ed1a64fe61c1355

subject: Use single quotes in deploy-steps.j2
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'shardy@redhat.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23811, 'name': 'Oliver Walsh', 'email': 'owalsh@redhat.com', 'username': 'owalsh'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-23 14:43:45.000000000', 'files': ['common/deploy-steps.j2', 'releasenotes/notes/hostvars-single-quotes-5976d22f2e1bd4f9.yaml'], 'message': 'Use single quotes in deploy-steps.j2

Use single quotes instead of double quotes in values of key/value pairs
in Ansible tasks in deploy-steps.j2. The use of double quotes can cause
escaping issues later when Ansible is actually run.

commit_message:
Use single quotes in deploy-steps.j2

Use single quotes instead of double quotes in values of key/value pairs
in Ansible tasks in deploy-steps.j2. The use of double quotes can cause
escaping issues later when Ansible is actually run.

Change-Id: I2f652cc9e40e23346fc212f0eb89a2f6b4a29023
Closes-Bug: #1744950

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: improve update of export RTs

The current behavior, on an update of export RTs
was to re-originated all recevied routes with the new
export RTs, includings for re-advertised routes for which
the export RTs are not the RTs that should be used
(it should be readvertise/to_rts).  This problem was not
exposed in the use made of readvertisements by BGPVPN
and SFC drivers.

Another issue is that there was a concurrency issue
between VPNInstance reading the list of received routes,
and RouteTableManager populating this list, resulting
in rare occurences of such a traceback:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/stack/new/networking-bagpipe/networking_bagpipe/bagpipe_bgp/api/controllers.py", line 210, in process
    self.manager.plug_vif_to_vpn(**attach_params)
  File "/opt/stack/new/networking-bagpipe/networking_bagpipe/bagpipe_bgp/common/log_decorator.py", line 40, in wrapper
    return method(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/stack/new/networking-bagpipe/networking_bagpipe/bagpipe_bgp/vpn/manager.py", line 338, in plug_vif_to_vpn
    vpn_instance.update_route_targets(import_rts, export_rts)
  File "/opt/stack/new/networking-bagpipe/networking_bagpipe/bagpipe_bgp/common/log_decorator.py", line 40, in wrapper
    return method(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/stack/new/networking-bagpipe/networking_bagpipe/bagpipe_bgp/vpn/vpn_instance.py", line 458, in update_route_targets
    for route_entry in self.get_route_entries():
Set changed size during iteration

Change-Id: Ie55b29f4620c99e9ba3ba1c402ed0f7cf1cc9e98

[{'created': '2017-08-08 18:28:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Use tasks for rhel registration

RHEL registration was implemented using the ExtraConfig interface.
However, this overrides an operator integration point. This can lead to
confusion when using the RHEL registration environment and also trying
to use ExtraConfig for some other configuration. In which case, the last
specified mapping would win, but with no clear indiciation of why the
other was not applied.

Use a custom Task, which by convention, are reserved for internal
TripleO usage for RHEL registration instead of the ExtraConfig
interface.

commit_message:
Use tasks for rhel registration

RHEL registration was implemented using the ExtraConfig interface.
However, this overrides an operator integration point. This can lead to
confusion when using the RHEL registration environment and also trying
to use ExtraConfig for some other configuration. In which case, the last
specified mapping would win, but with no clear indiciation of why the
other was not applied.

Use a custom Task, which by convention, are reserved for internal
TripleO usage for RHEL registration instead of the ExtraConfig
interface.

Change-Id: Idb5189337782583dd8075eeceea4dfa89ad33657
Closes-Bug: 1709441

subject: If virtualenv is broken, force re-install it
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 12:41:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'If virtualenv is broken, force re-install it

The virtualenv_support folder missing from the repo
container when upgrading due to the implementation
in the repo_build role which removes it. In order
to prevent breaking the virtualenv tooling, [1] is
being submitted. However, we still need to handle
the situation where the upgrade is done from a
version before that patch is implemented.

This patch implements a force-reinstallation of
virtualenv if the folder is missing.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/540351

commit_message:
If virtualenv is broken, force re-install it

The virtualenv_support folder missing from the repo
container when upgrading due to the implementation
in the repo_build role which removes it. In order
to prevent breaking the virtualenv tooling, [1] is
being submitted. However, we still need to handle
the situation where the upgrade is done from a
version before that patch is implemented.

This patch implements a force-reinstallation of
virtualenv if the folder is missing.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/540351

Change-Id: I2dcfa1abb46ee4e088dac7c9e77e9772ba8a269e
Closes-Bug: #1746935

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-03 14:17:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Views accessible via url even if user doesn't match policy rules

When a user doesn't match the policy rules of a panel then the panel tab is removed from the menu of the left, but panel views are still accessible using directly the url (ex /admin/flavors/).

In most of the case, views won't work correctly because of the lack of right in the backend, but it may cause trouble when you play with policies.

I think it could be more elegant to return directly a "You are not authorized to access this page" from the frontend when user try to access a view of a panel (via url) without matching the policy rules.

Change-Id: I7bc93fed29568adfc14d5bcadfc8728d3b5cf633
Closes-Bug: #1741051

I think it could be more elegant to return directly a "You are not
authorized to access this page" from the frontend when user try to
access a view of a panel (via url) without matching the policy rules.

Change-Id: I7bc93fed29568adfc14d5bcadfc8728d3b5cf633
Closes-Bug: #1741051
', 'number': 9}]
commit_message:
Views accessible via url even if user doesn't match policy rules

When a user doesn't match the policy rules of a panel then the panel tab
is removed from the menu of the left, but panel views are still
accessible using directly the url (ex /admin/flavors/).

In most of the case, views won't work correctly because of the lack of
right in the backend, but it may cause trouble when you play with
policies.

I think it could be more elegant to return directly a "You are not
authorized to access this page" from the frontend when user try to
access a view of a panel (via url) without matching the policy rules.

Change-Id: I7bc93fed29568adfc14d5bcadfc8728d3b5cf633
Closes-Bug: #1741051

Add api-ref and ironic state documentation for rescue

This patch adds following:

  - Updates api-ref with rescue interface fields introduced in
    API version 1.38

falsely identifies this as needing to be replaced with %{_datadir},

commit_message:
Add monasca-transform

Include monasca-transform, the aggregation engine for Monasca.
Also requires Apache Spark to be installed separately.

Specifying a Requires: spark == 1.6.3 seems desirable, but there
is currently no package widely available in the community for
installing that version, so the Requires: is left out to allow an
administrator to manually install from the .tgz or find a suitable
package.
To function properly, Monasca Transform requires a number of Spark
libraries (in .jar format) on the local system.  This install will
not change the versions of these .jar files listed in
/etc/monasca-tranform.conf, so an administrator should reference
the .conf file for names and versions to update.
Note that among those .jar files needed is a JDBC driver for connecting
to a MySQL-compatible database instance.  Drizzle-jdbc 1.3 is expected
and configured in monasca-transform.conf.

Different from other deployments, this .spec inserts an
entry_point into the setup.cfg to allow pbr to create a script,
then installs a .service file that points to the resulting
/usr/bin/monasca-transform script.

Note that the name of the monasca_transform directory in the
.tgz includes an _ and thus doesn't match the sname which
has a -. So instead a variable pypi_tar_name is used.

Note there is a hack for the generic_mysql_jar variable.  Rpmlint
falsely identifies this as needing to be replaced with %{_datadir},
when this is really a match string that needs to match the default
value in monasca-transform.conf.  Hack to get around this is to
concatenate two strings.

Future - need to try moving /etc/monasca-transform.conf

This cherry-pick includes: Updated monasca-transform to 0.11.0

(cherry picked from commit 9bd39e5e0be75383100e7b569cdff8e5f18be1ee)
(cherry picked from commit 3b60d511c3339a64b5fe8ec507797b52a8a5efd0)

Change-Id: Iaa2a5fc7526a19ad58f5199b5eb124caf18dcc45

commit_message:
[WIP] Extend datasource to access log data from monasca-log-api.

[Putting this up now as it is done to get some early feedback,
 but obviously can't be used till the API is implemented]

Extend the datasource to be able to return what Grafana refers to as
'doc' objects (essentially JSON) from the monasca-log-api. This will
allow viewing of log entries in Table panels side-by-side with metrics
in Graph or other panels. Due to the way Grafana handles datasource
endpoints, one datasource cannot access multiple endpoints, so two
instances of the plugin must be created. One for metrics, and one for
logs. This change should not break existing installations, and will
assume it's previous behaviour (metrics) unless explicitly configured.

Change-Id: I20249c698d14066abd84fe024b1c1175b2bf234f
Partially-Implements: blueprint log-query-api
Story: 2000934
Task: 4057

commit_message:
[Trivial] Allow flushing named pipe log handles

The named pipe handler provided by os-win is used by Nova when
consuming instance serial ports. For convenience, it allows logging
the named pipe output to a file (useful for storing the serial
console output).

The issue is that the log file never gets flushed, thus Nova returns
incomplete results. This change adds a method that may be used for
flushing the log file.

Change-Id: I4b5eb7579ac0c92e9c3630539b0c4d76f5b98c6d
Closes-Bug: #1741494
(cherry picked from commit 1b99d30fa2dd83524e87dfc71a8333acb91b2742)

commit_message:
Fixes port security settings caching issue

When updating the MAC spoofing for a given vswitch port, its
Msvm_EthernetSwitchPortSecuritySettingData object is removed
and a new one is created, but the original object is not
cleared from the cache. Because of this, the next update will
fail with a Not Found exception.

This patch addresses this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1744755

Change-Id: I91b9000c64d269b7d5b1db9e0c6344bbd70e37b2
(cherry picked from commit 776270c4b3be0523f2ee2a73792b4a41bb52d6f5)

commit_message:
Allow ability to configure number of processes and threads

Users can configure the number of worker threads however when it's
not specified the calculated number of workers can get too large on
hosts with a large number of CPUs.

This also adds the setting of threads and processes to the UWSGI
configuration.

Change-Id: I003ab426488966cce46bd6fd297c79ada13c9668
Closes-Bug: #1745631

commit_message:
roles: bifrost-create-vm-nodes: Set NIC model to 'virtio'

The role already uses the virtio driver to improve the disk peformance.
We can also use the virtio driver for the NIC device in order to improve
the network performance of the test VM. However, users may want to
change that so we are adding a new test_vm_nic Ansible variable for
that.

Change-Id: I9e5c9a33f1f6903d39d0fa2721288d084071e733

commit_message:
tests: autospecs mock.patch and classes usages

By default, mock.patch's autospec argument is None, meaning that
there's no signature checking for the patched methods and funtions.

oslotest.mock_fixture.patch_mock_module fixes a few issues within
mock.patch functions, as well as setting autospec=True by default,
unless otherwise specified or new_callable, create, spec arguments
are passed in.

Updates HyperVBaseTestCase to autospec the classes used by different
*Ops classes.

Change-Id: Ifbdc185d0b50e29c5d5f3ff036141253d2323076
Partial-Bug: #1735588

commit_message:
Add example of deploying with privileged virt

This example is copied from the following opnfv review

https://gerrit.opnfv.org/gerrit/#/c/28675/26/config/quickstart_defaults.yaml

It seems to work well for me, I can deploy VMs via quickstart which
show up via virt-manager and should survive reboots because
the qcow2 files are stored in /home/stack.

Change-Id: Ifbd0d6eefaebc3e8aec986501e67eadb5d7aa9cd
Closes-Bug: #1692987

subject: Vagrantfile: Use rsync to copy working directory to VM
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-29 12:56:04.000000000', 'files': ['Vagrantfile'], 'message': "Vagrantfile: Use rsync to copy working directory to VM

Depending on the VM distro the working directory can either be rsync'd
to the VM or mounted. When the directory is mounted, various artifacts
are left behind from the test execution which is not desired especially
when the directory is shared between multiple VMs for parallel testing.
As such, it's best to simply copy the directory to the VM using 'rsync'
so each VM can get its own copy.

Change-Id: I2ef84692b57e136fc6008f33f3e48f861f9a58da
Link: I1aab7d3f0d26f35dea84ae088fe78cfd2de79366
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Vagrantfile: Use rsync to copy working directory to VM

Depending on the VM distro the working directory can either be rsync'd
to the VM or mounted. When the directory is mounted, various artifacts
are left behind from the test execution which is not desired especially
when the directory is shared between multiple VMs for parallel testing.
As such, it's best to simply copy the directory to the VM using 'rsync'
so each VM can get its own copy.

Change-Id: I2ef84692b57e136fc6008f33f3e48f861f9a58da
Link: I1aab7d3f0d26f35dea84ae088fe78cfd2de79366

subject: Add SELinux python support to ansible-runtime venv
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-31 14:41:51.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/bootstrap-ansible.sh'], 'message': 'Add SELinux python support to ansible-runtime venv

This patch adds python bindings for SELinux to the ansible-runtime
venv. It allows ansible to download files and perform other tasks
that require SELinux support (such as downloading the cirros image
during the tempest role run).

A symlink is insufficient based on how the SELinux python module is
structured.

Closes-Bug: 1746283
Change-Id: Ieddf37860f8b84d965d0206e49a0b38f6fc3d2ba
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add SELinux python support to ansible-runtime venv

This patch adds python bindings for SELinux to the ansible-runtime
venv. It allows ansible to download files and perform other tasks
that require SELinux support (such as downloading the cirros image
during the tempest role run).

A symlink is insufficient based on how the SELinux python module is
structured.

Closes-Bug: 1746283
Change-Id: Ieddf37860f8b84d965d0206e49a0b38f6fc3d2ba

commit_message:
Set Horizon default member role to 'Member'

As of Ib85479442ec68f9a67615c23e5c39bd217c9b109 Keystone no longer
creates the _member_ role, which Horizon relies on to assign users to
projects. The Member role should still get created as part of a TripleO
deployment, switch Horizon to using that instead.

Change-Id: Ieebc27a742ebe9f7f68be1f489b142eac13e5b14
